FlashFX API: Flash Mapping Layer - FML

Send comments on this topic.
The FML (Flash Mapping Layer) is the layer of FlashFX which provides a "window" into the flash which may be accessed. The FML is the lowest level of FlashFX which may be directly accessed by an application via FlashFX API function calls.

FML Disks are defined in the ffxconf.h file (typically), and are normally specified as a range of kilobytes, however FML Disks must start and stop on erase block boundaries.

FML Disks cannot overlap each other. If a given FML Disk includes a range of erase blocks, an attempt to create another FML Disk mapping which includes one or more of those blocks will fail.

FML Disks may span multiple Devices, so long as the Devices have substantially similar underlying characteristics. See the Advanced Topics section for more details.

The FML interface consists of a set of functions and macros. The functions are used for creating, destroying, and otherwise managing FML instances. The macros are used for FML I/O.

The public interface to the FML interface is defined in fxfmlapi.h.

Summary

FfxFmlCreate   Create an FML instance, which is a window mapped onto a Device, thereby creating a Disk.
FfxFmlDestroy   Destroy an FML instance which was created with FfxFmlCreate .
FfxFmlDeviceInfo   Returns information about a physical Device (DEVn) The Device specified by nDeviceNum must already be created before calling this function.
FfxFmlDeviceRangeEnumerate   Enumerate ranges of blocks on a given Device.
FFXFMLDEVINFO   Contains information about a Device, and is filled in by FfxFmlDeviceInfo .
FfxFmlDiskInfo   Return information about a Disk.
FfxFmlHandle   Obtain the FFXFMLHANDLE for a given Disk number.
FFXFMLINFO   Contains information about a Disk, as returned by FfxFmlDiskInfo .
FfxFmlIORequest   Dispatch an FML level I/O request.
FfxFmlParameterGet   Get a FlashFX system parameter.
FfxFmlParameterSet   Set a FlashFX system parameter.
FfxFmlPerfLogDispatch   This function dispatches requests for FML and lower layers to retrieve PerfLog information and record it using an external interface.
FMLERASE_BLOCKS   Erase one or more blocks in an FML Disk.
FMLERASE_BOOT_BLOCKS   Erase one or more boot blocks in an FML Disk.
FMLERASE_RAWBLOCKS   Erase one or more raw blocks (not remapped by BBM).
FMLEXPEND_PAGE   Expend a NAND page.
FMLLOCK_BLOCKS   Lock one or more blocks in an FML Disk.
FMLLOCK_FREEZE   Lock the flash such that it cannot be unlocked short of restarting.
FMLLOCK_OTP   Lock OTP pages.
FMLREAD_CONTROLDATA   Read control bytes from an FML Disk.
FMLREAD_NATIVEPAGES   Reads corrected main page and correct spare data from one or more pages of an FML Disk.
FMLREAD_OTPPAGES   Read main page data from an OTP page.
FMLREAD_PAGES   Read one or more pages from an FML Disk.
FMLREAD_RAWPAGES   Read uncorrected main page and spare data from one or more pages of a raw FML Disk (not remapped by BBM).
FMLREAD_SPARES   Read spare area data from one or more pages of an FML Disk.
FMLREAD_TAGGEDPAGES   Read main page and tag data from one or more pages of an FML Disk.
FMLREAD_TAGS   Read tag data from one or more pages of an FML Disk.
FMLREAD_UNCORRECTEDPAGES   Read uncorrected main page and spare data from one or more pages of an FML Disk.
FMLUNLOCK_BLOCKS   Unlock one or more blocks in an FML Disk.
FMLWRITE_CONTROLDATA   Write control bytes to an FML Disk.
FMLWRITE_NATIVEPAGES   Writes a main page and given spare data to one or more pages of an FML Disk.
FMLWRITE_OTPPAGES   Write main page data to an OTP page.
FMLWRITE_PAGES   Write one or more pages to an FML Disk.
FMLWRITE_RAWPAGES   Write uncorrected main page and spare data to one or more pages of a raw FML Disk (not remapped by BBM).
FMLWRITE_SPARES   Write spare area data from one or more pages of an FML Disk.
FMLWRITE_TAGGEDPAGES   Write main page and tag data to one or more pages of an FML Disk.
FMLWRITE_TAGS   Write tag data to one or more pages of an FML Disk.
FMLWRITE_UNCORRECTEDPAGES   Write uncorrected main page and spare data from one or more pages of an FML Disk.
FML_GET_BLOCK_INFO   Queries the FIM and BBM to describe the requested erase block.
FML_GET_BLOCK_STATUS   Get the block status value for an erase block in an FML Disk.
FML_GET_RAW_BLOCK_INFO   Queries the FIM and BBM to describe the requested erase block.

FfxFmlCreate

FFXFMLHANDLE FfxFmlCreate(
    FFXDISKHANDLE hDisk,
    FFXFIMDEVHANDLE hFimDev,
    unsigned nDiskNum,
    D_UINT32 ulStartBlock,
    D_UINT32 ulBlockCount,
    unsigned nFlags)
Create an FML instance, which is a window mapped onto a Device, thereby creating a Disk.

The ulStartBlock and ulBlockCount arguments specify the location and size of the window in terms of physical erase blocks.

Note - When the FFX_DISK_SPANDEVICES flag is used, the ulStartBlock value must not specify an offset which is beyond the length of the first Device.

Parameters

hDisk - The FFXDISKHANDLE to use
hFimDev - The handle to the FIM device, created by the DevMgr layer.
nDiskNum - The number for this Disk (DISKn).
ulStartBlock - The starting block number, relative to zero.
ulBlockCount - The number of blocks in the Disk. May be FFX_REMAINING to use all the remaining blocks in the Device.
nFlags - The flags to use, which may be zero or more of the following:
  • FFX_DISK_RAW
    		• - Create a raw Disk mapping, which is allowed to include the BBM area (if NAND). Only selected APIs may be used on the Disk if is is mapped in raw mode.
  • FFX_DISK_SPANDEVICES
    		• - If ulBlockCount is longer than the number of blocks remaining on the Device, and there is a subsequent Device with the same characteristics, allow the Disk to span the Devices.

    Return Value

    Returns an FFXFMLHANDLE if successful, otherwise NULL.

    FfxFmlDestroy

    FFXSTATUS FfxFmlDestroy( FFXFMLHANDLE hFML)
    Destroy an FML instance which was created with FfxFmlCreate.

    Parameters

    hFML - The handle for the FML instance to destroy.

    Return Value

    Returns an FFXSTATUS value indicating success or failure.

    FfxFmlDeviceInfo

    FFXSTATUS FfxFmlDeviceInfo(
        unsigned nDeviceNum,
        FFXFMLDEVINFO *pFDI)
    Returns information about a physical Device (DEVn)

    The Device specified by nDeviceNum must already be created before calling this function.

    Parameters

    nDeviceNum - The Device number
    pFDI - A pointer to the FFXFMLDEVINFO structure to fill

    Return Value

    Returns an FFXSTATUS value indicating success or failure.

    FfxFmlDeviceRangeEnumerate

    FFXSTATUS FfxFmlDeviceRangeEnumerate(
        unsigned nDevNum,
        D_UINT32 ulBlockNum,
        FFXFMLHANDLE *phFML,
        D_UINT32 *pulBlockCount)
    Enumerate ranges of blocks on a given Device.

    The enumeration returns the number of contiguous blocks remaining, both inside or outside existing Disk definitions.

    Parameters

    nDevNum - The Device number to examine.
    ulBlockNum - The block which denotes the start of the range to examine.
    phFML - A pointer to an FFXFMLHANDLE which will be set on exit if the given ulBlockNum is within a Disk. Will be NULL if it is not, or if an error occurs.
    pulBlockCount - A pointer to a D_UINT32 which will return the number of contiguous blocks until the end of the current Disk, the start of the next Disk, or the end of the Device. In the event of an error, this field will be set to zero.

    Return Value

    Returns an FFXSTATUS code indicating the state of the operation. Additionally the *phFML and *pulBlockCount values will be returned.

    FFXFMLDEVINFO

    Contains information about a Device, and is filled in by FfxFmlDeviceInfo.

    FfxFmlDiskInfo

    FFXSTATUS FfxFmlDiskInfo(
        FFXFMLHANDLE hFML,
        FFXFMLINFO *pFI)
    Return information about a Disk.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle
    pFI - A pointer to the FFXFMLINFO structure to fill

    Return Value

    Returns an FFXSTATUS value indicating success or failure.

    FfxFmlHandle

    FFXFMLHANDLE FfxFmlHandle( unsigned nDiskNum)
    Obtain the FFXFMLHANDLE for a given Disk number.

    Parameters

    nDiskNum - The Disk number

    Return Value

    Returns an FFXFMLHANDLE if successful, otherwise NULL.

    FFXFMLINFO

    Contains information about a Disk, as returned by FfxFmlDiskInfo.

    FfxFmlIORequest

    FFXIOSTATUS FfxFmlIORequest(
        FFXFMLHANDLE hFML,
        FFXIOREQUEST *pIOR)
    Dispatch an FML level I/O request. See fxiosys.h for a description of the various I/O request functions. Alternatively use the FML macro interface in fxfmlapi.h to dispatch requests.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle
    pIOR - A pointer to the FFXIOREQUEST structure to use

    Return Value

    Returns an FFXIOSTATUS structure indicating the results of the request.

    FfxFmlParameterGet

    FFXSTATUS FfxFmlParameterGet(
        FFXFMLHANDLE hFML,
        FFXPARAM id,
        void *pBuffer,
        D_UINT32 ulBuffLen)
    Get a FlashFX system parameter. If the parameter ID is not recognized for this layer, the request will be passed to the next lower software layer.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle.
    id - The parameter identifier (FFXPARAM_*).
    pBuffer - A pointer to the buffer in which to store the value. May be NULL which causes this function to return the size of buffer required to store the parameter.
    ulBuffLen - The size of buffer. May be zero if pBuffer is NULL.

    Return Value

    Returns an FFXSTATUS code indicating success or failure. If pBuffer is NULL, but the id is valid, the returned FFXSTATUS value will be decodeable using the macro DCLSTAT_GETUINT20, which will return the buffer length required to store the parameter.

    FfxFmlParameterSet

    FFXSTATUS FfxFmlParameterSet(
        FFXFMLHANDLE hFML,
        FFXPARAM id,
        const void *pBuffer,
        D_UINT32 ulBuffLen)
    Set a FlashFX system parameter. If the parameter ID is not recognized for this layer, the request will be passed to the next lower software layer.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle.
    id - The parameter identifier (FFXPARAM_*).
    pBuffer - A pointer to the parameter data.
    ulBuffLen - The parameter data length.

    Return Value

    Returns an FFXSTATUS code indicating success or failure.

    FfxFmlPerfLogDispatch

    FFXSTATUS FfxFmlPerfLogDispatch(
        FFXFMLHANDLE hFML,
        DCLREQ_STATS *pReq)
    This function dispatches requests for FML and lower layers to retrieve PerfLog information and record it using an external interface.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle
    pReq - A pointer to the DCLREQ_STATS structure to use

    Return Value

    Returns an FFXSTATUS value indicating success or failure.

    FMLERASE_BLOCKS

    #define FMLERASE_BLOCKS(
        hFML,
        ulStart,
        ulCount,
        ioStat) \
    Erase one or more blocks in an FML Disk.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle.
    ulStart - The starting block number.
    ulCount - The count of blocks to process.
    ioStat - An FFXIOSTATUS structure to receive the results.

    Return Value

    None.

    FMLERASE_BOOT_BLOCKS

    #define FMLERASE_BOOT_BLOCKS(
        hFML,
        ulStart,
        ulCount,
        ioStat) \
    Erase one or more boot blocks in an FML Disk.

    This macro is to be used on NOR or ISWF style flash only.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle.
    ulStart - The starting block number.
    ulCount - The count of blocks to process.
    ioStat - An FFXIOSTATUS structure to receive the results.

    Return Value

    None.

    FMLERASE_RAWBLOCKS

    #define FMLERASE_RAWBLOCKS(

    ioStat - An FFXIOSTATUS structure to receive the results.

    Return Value

    None.

    FMLEXPEND_PAGE

    #define FMLEXPEND_PAGE(
        hFML,
        ulPage,
        ioStat) \
    Expend a NAND page.

    This macro may be used on NAND media only.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle.
    ulPage - The page number.
    ioStat - An FFXIOSTATUS structure to receive the results.

    Return Value

    None.

    #define FMLLOCK_BLOCKS(

    FMLLOCK_FREEZE

    #define FMLLOCK_FREEZE(
        hFML,
        ulStart,
        ulCount,
        ioStat) \
    Lock the flash such that it cannot be unlocked short of restarting.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle.
    ulStart - The starting block number.
    ulCount - The count of blocks to process.
    ioStat - An FFXIOSTATUS structure to receive the results.

    Return Value

    None.

    FMLLOCK_OTP

    #define FMLLOCK_OTP(
        hFML,
        ulStart,
        ulCount,
        pBuffer,
        ioStat) \
    Lock OTP pages.

    This macro may be used on NAND media only.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle.
    ulStart - The starting page number.
    ulCount - The count of pages to process
    pBuffer - A pointer to the data buffer to use.
    ioStat - An FFXIOSTATUS structure to receive the results.

    Return Value

    None.

    FMLREAD_CONTROLDATA

    #define FMLREAD_CONTROLDATA(
        hFML,
        ulByteOffset,
        ulCount,
        pBuffer,
        ioStat) \
    Read control bytes from an FML Disk.

    This macro is to be used on NOR or ISWF style flash only.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle.
    ulByteOffset - The byte offset.
    ulCount - The count of bytes to process.
    pBuffer - A pointer to the data buffer to use.
    ioStat - An FFXIOSTATUS structure to receive the results.

    Return Value

    None.

    FMLREAD_NATIVEPAGES

    #define FMLREAD_NATIVEPAGES(
        hFML,
        ulStart,
        ulCount,
        pPageBuff,
        pSpareBuff,
        ioStat)\
    Reads corrected main page and correct spare data from one or more pages of an FML Disk. The given address may be remapped by the BBM if necessary to fulfill the request. Reads will be aborted early in the event of any error and the ioStatus updated to describe the transfer.

    ioStat.ffxStat may be set to FFXSTAT_FIMUNCORRECTABLEDATA in the event that a reliable read is not possible, or this interface is not fully supported.

    This macro may be used on NAND media only.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle.
    ulStart - The starting page number.
    ulCount - The count of spares to process.
    pPageBuff - A pointer to the buffer to receive the data.
    pSpareBuff - A pointer to the buffer to receive the data.
    ioStat - An FFXIOSTATUS structure to receive the results.

    Return Value

    None.

    FMLREAD_OTPPAGES

    #define FMLREAD_OTPPAGES(
        hFML,
        ulStart,
        ulCount,
        pBuffer,
        ioStat) \
    Read main page data from an OTP page.

    This macro may be used on NAND media only.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle.
    ulStart - The starting page number.
    ulCount - The count of pages to process
    pBuffer - A pointer to the data buffer to use.
    ioStat - An FFXIOSTATUS structure to receive the results.

    Return Value

    None.

    FMLUNLOCK_BLOCKS

    #define FMLUNLOCK_BLOCKS(
        hFML,
        ulStart,
        ulCount,
        fInverted,
        ioStat) \
    Unlock one or more blocks in an FML Disk.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle.
    ulStart - The starting block number.
    ulCount - The count of blocks to process.
    fInverted - A flag meaning that the range should be inverted.
    ioStat - An FFXIOSTATUS structure to receive the results.

    Return Value

    None.

    FMLWRITE_CONTROLDATA

    #define FMLWRITE_CONTROLDATA(
        hFML,
        ulByteOffset,
        ulCount,
        pBuffer,
        ioStat) \
    Write control bytes to an FML Disk.

    This macro is to be used on NOR or ISWF style flash only.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle.
    ulByteOffset - The byte offset.
    ulCount - The count of bytes to process.
    pBuffer - A pointer to the data buffer to use.
    ioStat - An FFXIOSTATUS structure to receive the results.

    Return Value

    None.

    FMLWRITE_NATIVEPAGES

    #define FMLWRITE_NATIVEPAGES(
        hFML,
        ulStart,
        ulCount,
        pPageBuff,
        pSpareBuff,
        ioStat)\
    Writes a main page and given spare data to one or more pages of an FML Disk. The given address may be remapped by the BBM if necessary to complete the request. Write failures may cause a block replacement based on the error policy implementation and the ioStatus updated to describe the transfer.

    This macro may be used on NAND media only.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle.
    ulStart - The starting page number.
    ulCount - The count of spares to process.
    pPageBuff - A pointer to the buffer to receive the data.
    pSpareBuff - A pointer to the buffer to receive the data.
    ioStat - An FFXIOSTATUS structure to receive the results.

    Return Value

    None.

    FMLWRITE_OTPPAGES

    #define FMLWRITE_OTPPAGES(
        hFML,
        ulStart,
        ulCount,
        pBuffer,
        ioStat) \
    Write main page data to an OTP page.

    This macro may be used on NAND media only.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle.
    ulStart - The starting page number.
    ulCount - The count of pages to process
    pBuffer - A pointer to the data buffer to use.
    ioStat - An FFXIOSTATUS structure to receive the results.

    Return Value

    None.

    Return Value

    None.

    FML_GET_BLOCK_INFO

    #define FML_GET_BLOCK_INFO(
        hFML,
        ulBlockNum,
        ioStat,
        info) \
    Queries the FIM and BBM to describe the requested erase block. The given block number is subject to mapping by the BBM. The returned info will include the raw block number within the FIM device.

    This macro may be used on NAND media only.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle.
    ulBlockNum - The block number.
    ioStat - An FFXIOSTATUS structure to receive the results.
    info - An FFXIOR_FML_GET_BLOCK_INFO structure to receive results of the query.

    Return Value

    None.

    FML_GET_BLOCK_STATUS

    #define FML_GET_BLOCK_STATUS(
        hFML,
        ulBlockNum,
        ioStat) \
    Get the block status value for an erase block in an FML Disk.

    This macro may be used on NAND media only.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle.
    ulBlockNum - The block number.
    ioStat - An FFXIOSTATUS structure to receive the results.

    Return Value

    None.

    FML_GET_RAW_BLOCK_INFO

    #define FML_GET_RAW_BLOCK_INFO(
        hFML,
        ulBlockNum,
        ioStat,
        info) \
    Queries the FIM and BBM to describe the requested erase block. The given block number is a raw block number from within the FIM Device.

    This macro may be used on NAND media only.

    Parameters

    hFML - The FML handle.
    ulBlockNum - The raw block number.
    ioStat - An FFXIOSTATUS structure to receive the results.
    info - An FFXIOR_FML_GET_BLOCK_INFO structure to receive results of the query.

    Return Value

    None.
